chat.content:
I will give you a Coq proof state, including both hypotheses and a specific goal and your need to prove it. Your response should be a singular code block of Coq proof, without any additional explanation or commentary. Follow to these guidelines:
Introduce variables using unique names to avoid any conflicts.
Keep each command distinct and separated, avoid concatenations like ';' or '[cmd|cmd]'.
Organize your proof with bullets like '-', '+', and '*' instead of braces ({, }). Shift to their double symbols like '--' and '++', when necessary.
Effectively use given premises, follow the syntax and structure demonstrated in the examples provided.

Example 1:

Hypotheses:
n, m: nat
IHn: m + n = n + m

Goal:
m + S n = S n + m

Proof:
```simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.```

Example 2:
Hypotheses:

Goal:
forall n m : nat, m + n = n + m

```intros n m. induction n.
- simpl. auto.
- simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.```

Sovle This Proof State:

Hypotheses:


Goal:
TraverseVarIsIdentity

Premises:

SubstVar_Traverse = fun (V : Type) (H : Var V) (H0 : Traverse V V) (H1 : TraverseIdentifiesVar) (H2 : TraverseVarIsIdentity) => {| subst_var := fun (a : V) (k x : nat) => eq_ind_r (fun v : V => v = subst_idx a k x) (eq_ind_r (fun v : V => subst_idx v (0 + k) x = subst_idx a k x) eq_refl (lift_zero 0 a)) (traverse_identifies_var (fun l x0 : nat => subst_idx (lift l 0 a) (l + k) x0) 0 x) |} : forall (V : Type) (H : Var V) (H0 : Traverse V V), TraverseIdentifiesVar -> TraverseVarIsIdentity -> SubstVar Arguments SubstVar_Traverse {V}%type_scope {H H0}

rotate = fun (V : Type) (H : Var V) (T : Type) (H0 : Lift T) (H1 : Subst V T) (n : nat) (t : T) => subst (var n) 0 (shift (S n) t) : forall V : Type, Var V -> forall T : Type, Lift T -> Subst V T -> nat -> T -> T Arguments rotate {V}%type_scope {H} {T}%type_scope {H0 H1} _%nat_scope
Z.div_mul_le : forall a b c : Z, (0 <= a)%Z -> (0 < b)%Z -> (0 <= c)%Z -> (c * (a / b) <= c * a / b)%Z
Ring_polynom.PEopp : forall C : Type, Ring_polynom.PExpr C -> Ring_polynom.PExpr C
Build_Pun1 : forall (V : Type) (H : Var V) (T : Type) (H0 : Lift T) (H1 : Subst V T), (forall (t : T) (k : nat), subst (var k) (S k) (shift k t) = t) -> Pun1
Ring_theory.ARmul_0_l : forall (R : Type) (rO rI : R) (radd rmul rsub : R -> R -> R) (ropp : R -> R) (req : R -> R -> Prop), Ring_theory.almost_ring_theory rO rI radd rmul rsub ropp req -> forall x : R, req (rmul rO x) rO
inj_gt : forall n m : nat, n > m -> (Z.of_nat n > Z.of_nat m)%Z
Inductive positive : Set := xI : positive -> positive | xO : positive -> positive | xH : positive Arguments xI _%positive_scope Arguments xO _%positive_scope
ssrbool.keyed_mem_simpl : forall (T : Type) (p : ssrbool.pred_sort (ssrbool.predPredType T)) (k : ssrbool.pred_key (T:=T) p), ssrbool.keyed_pred k -> ssrbool.keyed_pred k
Inductive N : Set := N0 : N | Npos : positive -> N Arguments Npos _%positive_scope
Zeq_bool = fun x y : Z => match (x ?= y)%Z with | Eq => true | _ => false end : Z -> Z -> bool Arguments Zeq_bool (_ _)%Z_scope
fast_OMEGA14 : forall (v l1 l2 : Z) (x : positive) (P : Z -> Prop), P (l1 + l2)%Z -> P (v * Z.neg x + l1 + (v * Z.pos x + l2))%Z
traverse_extensional : TraverseRelative -> forall f g : nat -> nat -> my_value, (forall l x : nat, f l x = g l x) -> forall (t : my_term) (l : nat), traverse f l t = traverse g l t
Ring_polynom.PExpr_ind : forall (C : Type) (P : Ring_polynom.PExpr C -> Prop), P Ring_polynom.PEO -> P Ring_polynom.PEI -> (forall c : C, P (Ring_polynom.PEc c)) -> (forall p : positive, P (Ring_polynom.PEX C p)) -> (forall p : Ring_polynom.PExpr C, P p -> forall p0 : Ring_polynom.PExpr C, P p0 -> P (Ring_polynom.PEadd p p0)) -> (forall p : Ring_polynom.PExpr C, P p -> forall p0 : Ring_polynom.PExpr C, P p0 -> P (Ring_polynom.PEsub p p0)) -> (forall p : Ring_polynom.PExpr C, P p -> forall p0 : Ring_polynom.PExpr C, P p0 -> P (Ring_polynom.PEmul p p0)) -> (forall p : Ring_polynom.PExpr C, P p -> P (Ring_polynom.PEopp p)) ->...-> forall p : Ring_polynom.PExpr C, P p
fast_OMEGA12 : forall (v2 c2 l1 l2 k2 : Z) (P : Z -> Prop), P (v2 * (c2 * k2) + (l1 + l2 * k2))%Z -> P (l1 + (v2 * c2 + l2) * k2)%Z
lift_zero : forall k t : nat, lift 0 k t = t
Field_theory.NPEequiv : forall R : Type, R -> R -> (R -> R -> R) -> (R -> R -> R) -> (R -> R -> R) -> (R -> R) -> (R -> R -> Prop) -> forall C : Type, (C -> R) -> forall Cpow : Type, (N -> Cpow) -> (R -> Cpow -> R) -> Ring_polynom.PExpr C -> Ring_polynom.PExpr C -> Prop
lift = fun (T : Type) (Lift0 : Lift T) => let (lift) := Lift0 in lift : forall T : Type, Lift T -> nat -> nat -> T -> T Arguments lift {T}%type_scope {Lift} (_ _)%nat_scope
Nat2Z.inj_add : forall n m : nat, Z.of_nat (n + m) = (Z.of_nat n + Z.of_nat m)%Z
inj_eq : forall x y : nat, x = y -> Z.of_nat x = Z.of_nat y
Field_theory.rmul_ext_Proper : forall (R : Type) (radd rmul : R -> R -> R) (ropp : R -> R) (req : R -> R -> Prop), Ring_theory.ring_eq_ext radd rmul ropp req -> Morphisms.Proper (Morphisms.respectful req (Morphisms.respectful req req)) rmul
subst_idx = fun (V : Type) (H : Var V) (v : V) (k x : nat) => match lt_eq_lt_dec x k with | inleft (left _) => var x | inleft (right _) => v | inright _ => var (x - 1) end : forall V : Type, Var V -> V -> nat -> nat -> V Arguments subst_idx {V}%type_scope {H} _ (_ _)%nat_scope
fast_Zred_factor6 : forall (x : Z) (P : Z -> Prop), P (x + 0)%Z -> P x
BinPosDef.Pos.mul = fix mul (x y : positive) {struct x} : positive := match x with | (p~1)%positive => (y + (mul p y)~0)%positive | (p~0)%positive => ((mul p y)~0)%positive | 1%positive => y end : positive -> positive -> positive Arguments BinPosDef.Pos.mul (_ _)%positive_scope
Build_SubstVar : forall (A : Type) (H : Var A) (H0 : Subst A A), (forall (a : A) (k x : nat), subst a k (var x) = subst_idx a k x) -> SubstVar
LiftZero_idx = {| lift_zero := fun k t : nat => if le_gt_dec k t as s return ((if s then 0 + t else t) = t) then eq_refl else eq_refl |} : LiftZero
Build_TraverseIdentifiesVar : forall (V : Type) (H : Var V) (H0 : Traverse V V), (forall (f : nat -> nat -> V) (l x : nat), traverse f l (var x) = f l x) -> TraverseIdentifiesVar
fast_OMEGA16 : forall (v c l k : Z) (P : Z -> Prop), P (v * (c * k) + l * k)%Z -> P ((v * c + l) * k)%Z
TraverseRelative_my_value_my_term = {| traverse_relative := traverse_relative_my_value_my_term |} : TraverseRelative
fast_OMEGA15 : forall (v c1 c2 l1 l2 k2 : Z) (P : Z -> Prop), P (v * (c1 + c2 * k2) + (l1 + l2 * k2))%Z -> P (v * c1 + l1 + (v * c2 + l2) * k2)%Z
Traverse_my_value_my_value = {| traverse := traverse_my_value |} : Traverse my_value my_value
Zegal_left : forall n m : Z, n = m -> (n + - m)%Z = 0%Z
